sn35.70:1.1: Then Venerable Upavāna went up to the Buddha …
sn35.70:1.3: “Bhante, it is said that the Dhamma is presently evident.
sn35.70:1.4: In what way is the Dhamma presently evident, not involving time, verifiable, and goading-on, to be known by the wise for themselves?”
sn35.70:2.1: “Upavāna, take a bhikkhu who sees a sight with the eye. He feels both the sight and passion for the sight.
sn35.70:2.2: There being passion for sights internally, he understands: ‘There is passion for sights internally for me’.
sn35.70:2.5: the Dhamma is presently evident, not involving time, verifiable, and goading-on, to be known by the wise for themselves.
sn35.70:3.1: Take a bhikkhu who hears … smells … tastes … touches …
sn35.70:4.1: Take a bhikkhu who cognizes a phenomenon with the mental faculty. He feels both the phenomenon and passion for the phenomenon.
sn35.70:4.2: There being passion for phenomena internally, he understands: ‘There is passion for phenomena internally for me’.
sn35.70:4.5: the Dhamma is presently evident, not involving time, verifiable, and goading-on, to be known by the wise for themselves.
sn35.70:5.1: Now, take a bhikkhu who sees a sight with the eye. He feels the sight, but no passion for the sight.
sn35.70:5.2: There being no passion for sights internally, he understands: ‘There is no passion for sights internally for me’.
sn35.70:5.5: the Dhamma is presently evident, not involving time, verifiable, and goading-on, to be known by the wise for themselves.
sn35.70:6.1: Take a bhikkhu who hears … smells … tastes … touches …
sn35.70:7.3: Take a bhikkhu who cognizes a phenomenon with the mental faculty. He feels the phenomenon, but no passion for the phenomenon.
sn35.70:7.4: There being no passion for phenomena internally, he understands: ‘There is no passion for phenomena internally for me’.
sn35.70:7.5: This is how, Upavāna, the Dhamma is presently evident, not involving time, verifiable, and goading-on, to be known by the wise for themselves.
